title: Canopy’s Stock Is Down Because of an Analyst’s Dim View on Pot Players
text:
Canopy Growth stock has slid more than 10% over the past two days, despite a buoyant market. One thing weighing on the shares (ticker: CGC) may have been a report by MKM Partners that argues that the Canadian cannabis pioneer overpaid its executives and produced way more weed than it has sold.

The brokerage firm’s Canopy critique on Thursday was one of several initial reports by analyst Bill Kirk, who also launched coverage of big weed producers Aurora Cannabis (ACB), Tilray (TLRY), Cronos Group (CRON), and Curaleaf Holdings...
description: Investors’ expectations for cannabis companies like Canopy, Aurora, Tilray, Cronos and Curaleaf are just too high, says one MKM Partners analyst.
